page.title: 07The Churches.
page.content: THE EVANGELICAL CHURCH. Today we went to the Evangelical Church which is near our school. The money to build it came from the people who went to the church. They paid 40,000 pounds for the church to be built. The people who take the services are men, women or children. It sounds very surprising a child taking a service. They have three services a week. They built it near the shops because it is a central place where people pass and look. A man named Mervin Bird designed the church. They have a prizegiving in July for the children. THE CHURCH OF THE HOLY SPIRIT. The first church at Etching Hill was built in Church Lane in 1890. In 1963 they decided to build a larger church nearby. It was opened on Whitsunday 1964 and there is a large congregation. There is also a Sunday School.
